Useful when trying to create symmetrical maps.

Again doing with https://github.com/TM-PD/FirstDance/ what they did with us. This is mostly the work of @SNce. I just made it switchable with a toolbar-button and tweaked some values so it does not look crappy when I zoom out a lot on Windows.

data.body: This was 99% the work of @SNce back in the days. I just merged it back onto current bleed and added an icon. #2884

data.title: Improve Longbows (Balancing)
data.body:
Absolutely horrible and inefficient unit for its massive cost and build time.

Great at AA, not worth its price tag vs anything else.

It takes 12 Longbow missiles to destroy even 1 Medium tank and nearly a half dozen (~$12000 worth) to destroy most higher end structures in one pass. Furthermore, it takes much longer for it to do this than its Soviet equivalent the MiG. Now that MiGs are getting AA capabilities in addition, something needs to be done.

These are my proposed improvements, though I welcome others. Note that I am suggesting all of these improvements be implemented, not just some:

1: Reduce their build times by 25% to 36 seconds down from 48 seconds. 
2: Reduce their reload times to 0.5 per rocket down from 1 second per rocket. It is insane that it takes 8 full seconds to reload these things from empty! 
3: Reduce their cost by 25% to 1500 down from 2000 
4: Increase their rocket damage vs tanks/heavy armour by 50%. This would allow it to destroy a single Medium Tank while at full rocket capacity (they presently take 12 rockets to destroy).

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/136879-improve-longbows-balancing?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix Allied Mobile AA (Balancing)
data.body:
Just a repost really of issues discussed on Sleipnir's forum here:

http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=16183

Summary: Allies have no viable mobile anti-air. Rocket soldiers are too slow, vulnerable and ineffective vs most aircraft, especially Yaks, to be effective counters relative to their cost/build time, and Longbows are too late tier and too costly to be practical.

data.title: blossom trees: indestructible; blue slower
data.body:
Trees were made destructible; now they are indestructible.
Blue tiberium blossom trees regenerate slower than green tiberium. This keeps the green ones relevant in maps with both kinds of trees.
The blue ones produce at slightly over half speed, and slightly over 2x value, giving them a slight advantage. Blue's total value production rate is ~1.25x faster than green tib. blossom tree.

data.title: march_29.patch - blue blossom trees, ...
data.body:
Trees were made destructible; now they are indestructible.
Blue tiberium blossom trees regenerate slower than green tiberium. This keeps the green ones relevant.
The blue ones produce at slightly over half speed, and slightly over 2x value, giving them a slight advantage. Blue's total value production rate is ~1.25x faster than green tib. blossom tree.

data.title: Chocolatey package
data.body:
http://chocolatey.org brings package management to Windows (finally!) and allows automatic dependency resolution. We only need to create the required http://chocolatey.org/packages for OpenRA:
- [x] .NET 4.0 client profile is pre-existing
- [ ] OpenAL redistributible (optional, currently bundled)
- [ ] SDL2 (optional, currently bundled)
- [ ] freetype6 (optional, currently bundled)
- [ ] zlib1 (optional, currently bundled)
- [ ] liblua51 (optional, currently bundled)

As it is fully PowerShell scriptable so we could add in some nice newbie friendly things like Pixel Shader Version detection #2534 or checking if only Windows default drivers without OpenGL support are installed.

We can even use it to [set up a development environment](https://github.com/chocolatey/chocolatey/wiki/DevelopmentEnvironmentSetup) fast for beginners:
- [x] .NET 4.0 SDK is pre-existing
- [x] Git/GitHub for Windows (pre-existing)
- [x] Visual Studio Express 2012 for Windows Desktop (pre-existing)
- [x] or maybe SharpDevelop (pre-existing)
- [x] Paint.NET (for [Pixelart](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Pixelart), pre-existing)

data.title: Random map button ignores show in map chooser bool
data.body: It will expose the shellmap and worsed case scenario debug maps to stress test the pathfinder.

data.title: Replace Turret/Muzzle positioning code
data.body:
These patches introduce a new set of coordinates for representing position and orientation, and uses them to implement a much better system for positioning turrets and muzzles.

Key changes:
- New types for representing 3d types and rotations without requiring any floating point math.
- Turrets and weapons understand arbitrary 3d rotations, not just facing.
- Muzzles are now affected by recoil.
- Clearer yaml definitions for positioning turrets/muzzles (forward,right,up relative to body).
- Includes a debug layer for displaying the muzzle positions (might finally encourage someone to set them properly).
- Lays the foundations for voxels and TS/RA2 support.

I've tested this with RA, C&C, and my voxel test mod and I'm pretty sure I've covered all the edge cases. I have left rotors/spinners/etc with the old positioning for now, as these are better solved as part of #2841.

It will be straightforward from here to start fixing the coordinate-system mess and the rest of the combat code, but that should wait until these changes have been proven stable.

data.title: Added more cameos and showcase everything in developer mode
data.body:
I harvested community sites again:
- Just found [Tiberian Dawn Deluxe Cameo Pack](http://www.ppmsite.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=14518) by @Nyerguds and added the ones we did not already have except NOD flame thrower/tank, repair pad, helipad and the technology cntr.
- Instead added a cameo and high quality make animation for the tech center / prison  downloaded at http://kilkakon.com/projects.php?category=0&base=Command+and+Conquer (requires attribution) via http://cnc-comm.com/community/index.php?topic=2045.0

This also enables directly buildable construction yards in C&C and Dune 2000 when DevBuildEverything is on as @ScottNZ did for RA in commit 712b29d233f7dbf4a97e04c8eac1758df668f6e4 and I fixed the fake structures because the traits have changed (only available when cheats are on) as well as added the MRJ/MHQ units (notice that the spinner offset is not yet correct) to the build palette when cheating.

data.title: Cursor palettes are broken

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
This is easiest to see on the default move cursor on a desert map.

The problem was introduced by #2844, which forgets to enable the cursor palette before drawing the cursor, so it is drawn using the same row in the world palette instead.

data.title: Count Resources in Map Editor
data.body: Show what the ore/tiberium/spice laying on the ground is worth in cash when playing the game: total and in current selection. Useful to balance tournament maps. Best position would be the status bar.

data.title: Hotkey conflicts on playtest 0328

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
The 'B' hotkey has been for a long time assigned for Barracks. In the last few playtests, the power down hotkey has been introduced, with the button being 'B' for that as well.

I suggest that we change one of these hotkeys to something else by default. Since the Barracks hotkey has been in for longer, I propose that we change the hotkey for power down.

C, N and G are already used. What about H?

Currently, with this conflict, you can't build Barracks at all by using the hotkey. It will give you the power down cursor instead.

data.title: Customizable unit "hitbox"
data.body:
One thing that has ALWAYS annoyed me about WW's C&C games was that to the engine, the (visual) size of the unit didn't matter at all when applying the warheads' spread value. It would be far more logical if an AP shell hitting 8 pixels from the target center would still do full damage to a mammoth tank, but zero damage to a nearby infantry.

As I'm not a programmer I'm not sure how to best implement something like that.

My idea would be a Size tag, where 1 = 1 pixel hitbox (default), 2 = 3x3, 3 = 5x5 and so on (I assume 2x2 and the likes are problematic since they don't have a pixel at the center, but maybe I'm wrong). Now the Spread value would take the outer bound of this hitbox instead of the center pixel for damage calculation, making a mammoth with size 8 and speed 8 easier to hit than a heavy tank at speed 7 and size 5, for example. .

data.title: Hotfix: C&C classic don't crash on game start

data.title: mockup/idea for a new ingame chat UI
data.body:
To address the chat to the team / chat to all problem (Shift+Enter is not really known by new players), here is a mockup of what the ingame chat could look like:

![163035ingamechat](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311016/8ab49ca8-972d-11e2-910a-10dde4833023.png)

As you can see, there would be checkboxes to select the channel on which the player wants to chat (+ a close button to shut the chat system down)

data.title: fixes #2866: allow Button.Key to be a delegate
data.body:
Works nicely.
But one thing remains unclear to me: 
How does the yaml loader know not to load KeyFunc from yaml? Or would he try to if there were a "KeyFunc:" entry in the yaml file? How to prevent this?

fixes #2866

data.title: New Map Editor : Add a "Browse" button on the Select Map dialog box
data.body: Could you please add a "Browse" button onto the "Select Map" dialog box ?

data.title: New Map Editor : Allow "vertical scrolling" over the Tileset panel with mousewheel
data.body:
Please, could you add an option to scroll the Tileset vertically with the mousewheel ?

This is not crucial but it would be handy.. and fasten the mod creation..

data.title: New Map Editor : sync the minimap and the working area
data.body:
In the editor, the minimap helps the user know what part of the map he is editing.

But it would be useful if this minimap could be sync'ed with the working area.
- on this minimap, a rectangle would be displayed, matching the current area of the map
- moving this rectangle would also move the working area view
- if the user zooms out (in the working area) the rectangle (in the minimap) would change its size to match the area the user is viewing

![707604ScreenShot002](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311027/f2c82648-972d-11e2-96fa-a3c397dc0a1a.png)

data.title: New Map Editor : Clearly point out what tile is selected
data.body:
- When you use the new Editor and you click on a tile (on the left sidebar), you don't see what's your current selected tile. When a user clicks on a tile, it should be selected. OpenRA.Editor should surround this tile with a 2 pixels blue selection bracket. For example, this blue : 0000ff (R0 G0 B255)
- Also, the name of this tile (if available) should be shown in the statusbar.

![368931ScreenShot001](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311033/16613a7c-972e-11e2-8939-ed92bc93d9d1.png)

data.title: Cleanup the Desura crap
data.body: I did it wrong. The current setup will loop pre-launch wrapper scripts indefinitely instead of starting the game. However the editor will work because I gladly chose a different filename not understanding how the auto-generation from wildcards work. Those ugly shell-scripts are also dynamically generated by the Desura client so I updated https://github.com/lodle/Desurium/wiki/Notes-For-Publishing-On-Desura#linux accordingly with my new trial and error findings. A little help from http://www.desura.com/support would have been appreciated, but I only got `dunno about Linux` back. :anger:
